verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Go and get a potter’s earthen bottle, and take of the ancients of the people, and of the ancients of the priests;
verses.web: Thus said LORD, “Go, and buy a potter’s earthen container, and take some of the elders of the people, and of the elders of the priests;
verses.ct: The LORD said to Jeremiah, "Go and buy a clay jar from a potter. Then gather some of the elders of the people and some of the senior priests,

verses.kjv: And go forth unto the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the east gate, and proclaim there the words that I shall tell thee,
verses.web: and go out to the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the gate Harsith, and proclaim there the words that I will tell you.
verses.ct: and go out to the valley of Ben Hinnom, near the entrance of the Potsherd Gate. When you get there, proclaim the words I'm about to tell you.

verses.kjv: And say, Hear ye the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah, and inhabitants of Jerusalem; Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, the which whosoever heareth, his ears shall tingle.
verses.web: Say, ‘Hear LORD’s word, kings of Judah, and inhabitants of Jerusalem: LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says, “Behold, I will bring evil on this place, which whoever hears, his ears will tingle.
verses.ct: Say to them, 'Listen to the word of the LORD, you kings of Judah and people of Jerusalem! The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says this: "I am about to bring such disaster on this place that everyone who hears about it will have their ears ringing.

verses.kjv: Because they have forsaken me, and have estranged this place, and have burned incense in it unto other gods, whom neither they nor their fathers have known, nor the kings of Judah, and have filled this place with the blood of innocents;
verses.web: Because they have forsaken me, and have defiled this place, and have burned incense in it to other gods that they didn’t know, they, their fathers, and the kings of Judah, and have filled this place with the blood of innocents,
verses.ct: They have abandoned me and turned this place into something foreign to me. They've burned incense here to other gods — gods that neither they, nor their ancestors, nor the kings of Judah ever knew. And they have filled this place with the blood of innocent people.

verses.kjv: They have built also the high places of Baal, to burn their sons with fire for burnt offerings unto Baal, which I commanded not, nor spake it, neither came it into my mind:
verses.web: and have built the high places of Baal, to burn their children in the fire for burnt offerings to Baal, which I didn’t command, nor speak, which didn’t even enter into my mind.
verses.ct: They built shrines to Baal on the hilltops and burned their own children alive as offerings to him. I never commanded this. I never suggested it. It never even crossed my mind.

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that this place shall no more be called Tophet, nor The valley of the son of Hinnom, but The valley of slaughter.
verses.web: Therefore, behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that this place will no more be called ‘Topheth’, nor ‘The Valley of the son of Hinnom’, but ‘The valley of Slaughter’.
verses.ct: So the days are coming," declares the LORD, "when this place will no longer be called Topheth or the valley of Ben Hinnom. Instead, it will be called the Valley of Slaughter.

verses.kjv: And I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place; and I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, and by the hands of them that seek their lives: and their carcases will I give to be meat for the fowls of the heaven, and for the beasts of the earth.
verses.web: “ ‘ “I will make the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem void in this place. I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, and by the hand of those who seek their life. I will give their dead bodies to be food for the birds of the sky and for the animals of the earth.
verses.ct: Right here in this place, I will shatter every plan Judah and Jerusalem have made. I will let their enemies cut them down with the sword — the very people who want them dead. Their corpses will become food for the birds of the heavens and the wild animals.

verses.kjv: And I will make this city desolate, and an hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished and hiss because of all the plagues thereof.
verses.web: I will make this city an astonishment and a hissing. Everyone who passes by it will be astonished and hiss because of all its plagues.
verses.ct: I will turn this city into a wasteland that shocks everyone. Every person who passes by will gasp and shudder at the devastation they see.

verses.kjv: And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and they shall eat every one the flesh of his friend in the siege and straitness, wherewith their enemies, and they that seek their lives, shall straiten them.
verses.web: I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters. They will each eat the flesh of his friend in the siege and in the distress, with which their enemies, and those who seek their life, will distress them.” ’
verses.ct: The siege will be so brutal, and the starvation so severe — pressed in by enemies who want them dead — that people will eat the flesh of their own sons and daughters. Neighbors will devour each other just to survive."'

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou break the bottle in the sight of the men that go with thee,
verses.web: “Then you shall break the container in the sight of the men who go with you,
verses.ct: "Then, while the men who came with you are watching, smash the clay jar.

verses.kjv: And shalt say unto them, Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Even so will I break this people and this city, as one breaketh a potter’s vessel, that cannot be made whole again: and they shall bury them in Tophet, till there be no place to bury.
verses.web: and shall tell them, ‘LORD of Armies says: “Even so I will break this people and this city, as one breaks a potter’s vessel, that can’t be made whole again. They will bury in Topheth, until there is no place to bury.
verses.ct: Tell them, 'The LORD of hosts says this: "Just as this potter's jar is shattered beyond repair, so I will shatter this people and this city. The dead will be buried in Topheth until there's no room left for another grave.

verses.kjv: Thus will I do unto this place, saith the LORD, and to the inhabitants thereof, and even make this city as Tophet:
verses.web: This is what I will do to this place,” says LORD, “and to its inhabitants, even making this city as Topheth.
verses.ct: This is what I will do to this place," declares the LORD, "and to everyone living in it. I will make this entire city like Topheth.

verses.kjv: And the houses of Jerusalem, and the houses of the kings of Judah, shall be defiled as the place of Tophet, because of all the houses upon whose roofs they have burned incense unto all the host of heaven, and have poured out drink offerings unto other gods.
verses.web: The houses of Jerusalem, and the houses of the kings of Judah, which are defiled, will be as the place of Topheth, even all the houses on whose roofs they have burned incense to all the army of the sky and have poured out drink offerings to other gods.” ’ ”
verses.ct: The houses of Jerusalem and the palaces of Judah's kings will become as defiled as Topheth — every house where people went up on the rooftops to burn incense to the stars of the heavens and pour out drink offerings to other gods."'"

verses.kjv: Then came Jeremiah from Tophet, whither the LORD had sent him to prophesy; and he stood in the court of the LORD’s house; and said to all the people,
verses.web: Then Jeremiah came from Topheth, where LORD had sent him to prophesy, and he stood in the court of LORD’s house, and said to all the people:
verses.ct: Jeremiah then returned from Topheth, where the LORD had sent him to prophesy. He went and stood in the courtyard of the LORD's temple and addressed all the people.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring upon this city and upon all her towns all the evil that I have pronounced against it, because they have hardened their necks, that they might not hear my words.
verses.web: “LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says, ‘Behold, I will bring on this city and on all its towns all the evil that I have pronounced against it, because they have made their neck stiff, that they may not hear my words.’ ”
verses.ct: He said, "The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says this: 'I am about to bring down on this city and every town around it all the disaster I have declared against them, because they have been stubborn and refused to listen to my words.'"
